moves.10. Qf3: Good move.  Double threat.  First to capture the  d5 pawn.  Second to penetrate on the dark squares weakness.
moves.12... Bg7 13. Ba4+ Kf8: Black is only down a pawn but his King is stuck in the center. Bad position
moves.14. Qf4 Qa5:
Losing a piece.  Can you see it?  
Look for exploiting a pin.
To prepare d4 and to clear the c2 square for the Bishop to aim at f5.
moves.18... Rae8: Blunder!  He simply didn't see the Bishop aiming at e8.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C61), Bird's defence, Paulsen variation
